data.title: Help Centers Near You
data.text:
The purpose of a self-help program is to assist self-represented litigants resolve family law cases.

Persons working in a self-help program may provide information and approved forms to self-represented litigants, but may not give them legal advice or do legal research for them.

The map and self-help center listing below is divided by judicial circuit.

OR, follow this link for a list of self-help centers by county with links to information on court websites.

TIP: Many locations do not accommodate walk-ins and require an appointment. Please call first if you're not sure what to do.

Directory of Self-Help Programs in Florida by Judicial Circuit
